dc:title: House of Hospitality Dorothy Day 1939, Chapter One, pp. 1 - 26. Engaging vignettes about the daily work of the early depression era movement: helping the evicted, street corner speaking, the impersonal shelters run by the city, and the delightful conversation of children around the office.
